home.title: Dashboard
home.description: Binner is an inventory management app for makers, hobbyists and professionals.

search.title: Inventory
search.searchNotFound: No resuts found in inventory. Do you want to <1>Add</1> it?

inventory.privatePartInfoMessage: These values can be set manually and will not be synchronized automatically via apis.

message.uploadWait: Files can't be uploaded until the part is saved.

popup.bulkAddParts: Bulk add parts using a barcode scanner
popup.quantity: Use the mousewheel and CTRL/ALT to change step size
popup.lowStock: Alert when the quantity gets below this value
popup.location: A custom value for identifying the parts location
popup.binNumber: A custom value for identifying the parts location
popup.rememberLastSelection: Enable this toggle to remember the last selected values of: <1>Part Type, Mounting Type, Quantity, Low Stock, Project, Location, Bin Number, Bin Number 2</1>
popup.clear: Clear the form to default values
popup.alternateParts: Choose a different part to extract metadata information from. By default, Binner will give you the most relevant part and with the highest quantity available.
popup.mustAddPart: You must save the part before adding custom suppliers to it.
popup.cadModels: View CAD Models available for this part
popup.symbolName: Associate a KiCad symbol name with this part
popup.footprintName: Associate a KiCad footprint name with this part
popup.extensionValue: Associate a custom value with this part

lowInventory.title: Low Inventory
lowInventory.description: Use this page to reorder parts you are low on.<1/>You can define a custom <3>Low Stock</3> value per part in your inventory.

header.title: Bill of Materials
header.description: Manage your BOM by creating PCB(s) and adding your parts.

bom.notEnoughPartsToProducePcb: You do not have enough parts to produce this PCB.
bom.notEnoughPartsToProduceBom: You do not have enough parts to produce your entire BOM.
bom.noPartsAssigned: Assign parts to get a count of how many times you can produce this PCB.
bom.pcbProduceCount: You can produce this PCB <1>{{count}}</1> times with your current inventory.
bom.bomProduceCount: You can produce your entire BOM <1>{{count}}</1> times with your current inventory.

header.description:
Bill of Materials, or BOM allows you to manage inventory quantities per project. You can reduce quantities for each PCB you produce, check which parts you need to buy more of and analyze costs.

Choose or create the project to manage BOM for.

partTypes.title: Part Types
partTypes.description: Part Types allow you to separate your parts by type. <1>Parent</1> types allow for unlimited part type hierarchy.<3 />For example: OpAmps may be a sub-type of IC's, so OpAmp's parent type is IC.
partTypes.partCount: The number of parts in this category

exportData.title: Import/Export Data
exportData.description: Import or Export your Binner database to a human-readable format.
exportData.uploadNote: Drag a document to upload, or click to select files
exportData.fileNotSupported: File '{{name}}' with mime type '{{type}}' is not an accepted image type!

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: Binner includes a suite of free utilities common to daily life in electrical engineering.

barcodeScanner.title: Barcode Scanner
barcodeScanner.description: Test your barcode scanner to see what values it outputs.

settings.title: Settings
settings.description: Configure your integrations, printer configuration, as well as label part templates. <1 /> Additional help can be found on the <3>Wiki</3>

confirm.mustAuthenticate: External Api is requesting that you authenticate first. You will be redirected back after authenticating with the external provider.

settings.integrationsDescription: To integrate with DigiKey, Mouser, Arrow or Octopart/Nexar API's you must obtain API keys for each service you wish to use. <1 /> Adding integrations will greatly enhance your experience.
settings.swarmDescription: Swarm is a free API service provided by <1>Binner's cloud service</1> that contains part metadata from many aggregate sources. It is the primary source of part, media and datasheet information. Registering for your own API Keys will give you higher request limits and can be obtained at <3>https://binner.io/swarm</3>
settings.digikeyDescription: Digikey API Keys are free and can be obtained at <1>https://developer.digikey.com/</1>
settings.mouserDescription: Mouser API Keys can be obtained at <1>https://www.mouser.com/api-hub/</1>
settings.arrowDescription: Arrow API Keys can be obtained at <1>https://developers.arrow.com/api/index.php/site/page?view=requestAPIKey</1>
settings.octopartNexarDescription: Octopart/Nexar API Keys can be obtained at <1>https://portal.nexar.com/sign-up</1>
settings.printerConfigDescription: Configure your printer name as it shows up in your environment (Windows Printers or CUPS Printer Name)
settings.partLabelTemplateDescription: Part labels are printed according to this template.

popup.forgetCredentials: Forget any cached credentials and force reauthentication with DigiKey
popup.swarmEnabled: Choose if you would like to enable Binner Swarm support.
popup.swarmApiKey: Swarm api key is optional. By registering a free or paid api key you will receive higher request limits accordingly.
popup.swarmTimeout: Swarm api request timeout. Default: '00:00:05' (5 seconds)
popup.digikeyEnabled: Choose if you would like to enable DigiKey support. You will occasionally be asked to login to your DigiKey account to allow Binner to access your information.
popup.digikeySite: Choose the DigiKey site to use.
popup.digikeyClientId: Your DigiKey <1>Client ID</1>.<3><4/>Figure 1. DigiKey Client Id settings</3>
popup.digikeyClientSecret: Your DigiKey <1>Client Secret</1>.<3><4/>Figure 1. DigiKey Client Secret settings</3>
popup.digikeyApiUrl: DigiKey's API Url. This will either be <1>api.digikey.com</1> (live) or <3>sandbox-api.digikey.com</3> (for testing only)
popup.digikeyOAuthPostbackUrl: Binner's postback url must be registered with DigiKey exactly as specified here, on DigiKey this is named <1>Callback URL</1>. This should almost always be localhost, and no firewall settings are required as your web browser will be making the request.<3/><4/><5>Example: </5><6>localhost:8090/Authorization/Authorize</6><7/><8><9/>Figure 1. DigiKey Callback URL</8>
popup.mouserEnabled: Choose if you would like to enable Mouser support.
popup.mouserSearchApiKey: Your api key for accessing the search api.
popup.mouserOrderApiKey: Your api key for accessing the orders api.
popup.mouserCartApiKey: Your api key for accessing the shopping cart api.
popup.mouserApiUrl: Mouser's API Url. This will be api.mouser.com
popup.arrowEnabled: Choose if you would like to enable Arrow support.
popup.arrowApiUrl: Arrow's API Url. This will be api.arrow.com
popup.octopartEnabled: Choose if you would like to enable Octopart/Nexar support.
popup.printerPrinterName: Your printer name as it appears in Windows, or CUPS (Unix).
popup.printerPartLabelSource: The label paper source to use.
popup.partLabelName: The name of the label model installed in your printer. This will be specific to your printer, and must be defined in your appsettings.json under <1>WebHostServiceConfiguration.PrinterConfiguration.LabelDefinitions</1>
popup.barcodeSupportEnabled: Choose if you would like to enable barcode support.
popup.barcodeProfile: Choose the barcode profile to use for your scanner.
popup.barcodePrefix: The prefix used for 2D barcodes, usually '[)>'.
popup.barcodeBufferTime: The buffer time in milliseconds the barcode will scan data for. Some scanners require more or less time. Default: 80
popup.barcodeIsDebug: Enabling Barcode debug mode will print diagnostic information to the browser console.
popup.maxKeystrokeThresholdMs: The maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait between keypresses.
popup.prefix2d: The prefix used for 2D barcodes, usually '[)>'.

datasheet.title: Datasheet Search
datasheet.description: Search for datasheets by part number.

orderImport.title: Order Import
orderImport.enterOrderNumber: Enter your order number for the supplier.
orderImport.instructions: For <1>DigiKey</1> orders, this is the <3>Sales Order #</3>.<4 />For <6>Mouser</6> orders, this is the <8>Web Order #</8>.<10 />For <12>Arrow</12> orders, this is the <14>Order Number</14>.
orderImport.mouserNote: <0>Note:</0> Mouser only supports Web Order # so make sure when importing that you are using the Web Order # and <2>not the Sales Order #</2>
orderImport.arrowNote: <0>Note:</0> Arrow requires that you first request access to their Order API by sending them an email. See <2>Arrow Order Api</2>

printLabels.title: Print Labels
printLabels.description: Print custom multi-line labels for your storage bins.<1 />Print history is kept so you can reuse templates for your labels.
printLabels.addLineToStart: Add a line to get started.
printLabels.barcodeFontsNotice: Barcode fonts may be problematic. Values must be surrounded by asterix, ex: *value* or parenthesis, ex: (value) to encode correctly. For best accuracy use a font size of [6, 12, 18, 24, 30, 36]. Alternatively, toggle IsBarcode and a barcode will be drawn for you and no special characters needed.

project.title: Edit Project
project.description: Projects are used as part of your BOM, allowing you to associate parts to multiple PCBs.

popup.name: Enter the name of your project/BOM
popup.description: Enter a description that summarizes your project
popup.color: Associate a color with this project for easy identification
popup.includeUnassociated: Indicates if parts not associated with a PCB were produced
popup.totalConsumed: The total number of parts consumed

ohmsLaw.title: Ohms Law Calculator
ohmsLaw.description: Ohms Law explains the relationship between voltage, current and resistance. Input any 2 values to calculate the other 2 values.

voltDividerCalc.title: Voltage Divider Calculator
voltDividerCalc.description: A voltage divider uses 2 resistors to reduce a voltage to a fraction of its input voltage.

admin.title: Admin
admin.description: System administration for managing your installation.

users.title: User Management
users.baseDescription: Manage the users of your system.

confirm.areYouSure: Are you sure you want to delete this user?

popup.name: Specify the user's first and last name

activateLicense.title: Activate License
activateLicense.description: Enter your license key to enable pro features on your local Binner installation. Don't have a license key? Visit <1>Binner Cloud</1>

updateParts.title: Update Part Metadata
updateParts.description: Refresh information from external APIs and choose which fields you would like to update.

systemInfo.title: System Information
systemInfo.baseDescription: Get information on your Binner installation.
systemInfo.description: Information about your Binner installation. These settings can be found in the service configuration file 'appsettings.json'

backupRestore.title: Backup/Restore
backupRestore.baseDescription: Backup or restore your Binner installation.

backup.title: Backup / Restore
backup.baseDescription: Backup or restore your Binner installation.
backup.description: Create a backup or restore from a backup.
backup.backupDescription: Create a snapshot of your Binner installation.

printing.title: Printing
printing.description: Printing of labels and label templates.

labelTemplates.title: Label Templates
labelTemplates.description: Edit part label and custom label templates.

printLabels.title: Print Custom Labels
printLabels.baseDescription: Print custom labels for any task.

bulkprint.title: Bulk Print
bulkprint.description: Print labels for multiple parts at once.

barcodeScannerInput.supportsBarcodeScanning: This page supports barcode scanning. <1>More Info</1>

popup.lowStock: Quantities below this value will indicate the part is low on stock.
popup.quantity: The quantity of parts currently in stock.

confirm.deletePart: Are you sure you want to delete part {{partNumber}}?

addBomPartModal.title: BOM Management
addBomPartModal.description: Add a part to your BOM, optionally associating it with a particular PCB.
addBomPartModal.confirmAddUnassociated: You have not selected a part from your inventory.<1/>Are you sure you want to add this part <3>{{keyword}}</3> without associating it to a part in your inventory?<5/><6/><7>Note: You will still be able to manage it's quantity if you choose to proceed, but it will not appear in your inventory.</7>

popup.selectPcb: Select the pcb you would like to add parts to. If you choose not to select a PCB, the part will be added to your BOM without PCB associations.
popup.quantity: Enter the quantity of this part required to produce a single PCB.
popup.referenceIds: Enter a custom Reference Id you can use for identifying this part.<1/>Examples: <3>Optoisolator1</3>, <5>Capacitor Array</5>
popup.schematicReferenceIds: Enter one or more Schematic Reference Ids you can use for identifying this part on the PCB silkscreen.<1/>Examples: <3>D1</3>, <5>C2</5>, <7>Q1</7>
popup.notes: Enter any custom notes for this part.
popup.partNumber: Search for a part in your inventory
popup.customDescription: Enter your own custom description for this part.

addPcbModal.title: BOM Management
addPcbModal.description: Adding a PCB allows you to associate your parts with a specific PCB, and even multiple PCBs within a project.

popup.name: Enter the name of your pcb board or module
popup.description: Enter a description describing what your pcb does. (<1>optional</1>)
popup.quantity: Enter a quantity (multiplier) of PCB's produced each time you create a PCB. This should normally be 1, unless you require several copies of the same PCB for producing your BOM project.<1/><2/><3>Example:</3> An audio amplifier may require 2 of the same PCB's, one for each left/right channel each time you produce the entire assembly.
popup.cost: The cost to produce a single PCB board (without components). If using quantity, only specify the cost for a single board as quantity will be taken into consideration.
popup.serialNumberFormat: Enter your serial number format as a string. The left-most portion of the string will be incremented by 1 each time you produce a PCB. (<1>optional</1>)<2/>Example: <4>SN00000000</4>

options.unassociatedDescription: Produce parts not associated to a PCB

popup.pcbs: Select the pcb(s) you would like to produce. If you don't define PCB's, choose Unassociated or All.
popup.quantity: Enter the quantity of PCBs you are producing.
popup.nextSerialNumber: The next serial number assigned to the board
popup.maxQty: The maximum number of boards you can produce
popup.parts: The number of parts on the board
popup.outOfStock: The number of parts on the board that are out of stock
popup.serialNumber: The next PCB will have it's serial number started at this value.

popup.content: Template can reference any part field, example: {partNumber}, {description}, {manufacturer}, {location}, {binNumber}, {cost} etc. See <1>Wiki</1> for all available tags.
popup.autoSize: Text size will be automatically determined.
popup.upperCaseText: Render the text as all upper-case characters.
popup.lowerCaseText: Render the text as all lower-case characters.
popup.barcode: Render the Content value encoded as a barcode.
popup.rotateDegrees: Rotate the text in degrees. Example: 90

popup.rememberLocation: Repeat the location of each added part

duplicatePartModal.title: Duplicate Part
duplicatePartModal.description: There is a possible duplicate part already in your inventory.

labelSelectionModal.title: Label Editor
labelSelectionModal.description: Select an existing label to edit or create a new one.
labelSelectionModal.chooseLabel: Choose the label you wish to edit

labelSetNameModal.description: Enter a name for your new label.

message.noChildPartTypes: There are no child part types.
message.noPartInfo: No part information is available for '{{partNumber}}'. You are subscribed to updates and will be automatically updated when the part is indexed.
message.unableToUpload: Unable to upload. Check that the file is not locked or deleted.
message.failedSavePart: Failed to update, check Part Type and Mounting Type
message.scanPartExists: Part exists in inventory. You can edit it's details or remove it from your scan.

confirm.deleteProject: Are you sure you want to delete this project and your entire BOM?
confirm.removeBomParts: Are you sure you want to remove these <1>{{quantity}}</1> part(s) from your BOM?
confirm.deletePcb: Are you sure you want to delete this PCB and it's parts from your BOM?
confirm.deletePartType: Are you sure you want to delete part type <1>{{name}}</1>?
confirm.deletePart: Are you sure you want to delete part <1>{{name}}</1>?
confirm.deleteLocalFile: Are you sure you want to delete this local file named <1>{{name}}</1>?
confirm.permanent: This action is <1>permanent and cannot be recovered</1>.
confirm.deleteRecord: Are you sure you want to delete this record?
confirm.deleteHistory: Are you sure you want to delete this history record?
confirm.partsWillBeBackInStock: All consumed parts will be placed <1>back in stock</1>.
confirm.clearScan: Are you sure you want to clear your scanned results?

error.failedToRemoveBomParts: Failed to remove parts from BOM!
error.failedClearedCredentials: Failed to clear cached credentials for {{apiName}}
error.invalidOrder: Hmmm, that doesn't look like a valid order number!
error.invalid2dBarcode: Hmmm, I don't recognize that 2D barcode!

bom.addPart: Add a part to the BOM
bom.removePart: Remove selected parts from the BOM
bom.addPcb: Add a PCB to this project
bom.producePcb: Reduce inventory quantities when a PCB is assembled
bom.filterOutOfStock: Select to only show out of stock parts
bom.pcb: Indicates which PCB your part is assigned to. A PCB assignment is optional, all unassigned parts will appear in the <1>All</1> tab.
bom.quantity: The quantity of parts required for a single PCB
bom.inventoryQuantity: The quantity of parts currently in inventory
bom.referenceId: Your custom <1 />reference Id(s) you can use for identifying this part.
bom.schematicReferenceId: Your custom <1 />schematic reference Id(s) that identify the part on the PCB silkscreen. <3/>Examples: <5>D1</5>, <7>C2</7>, <9>Q1</9>
bom.displayAll: Displays all parts including parts not associated with a PCB.
bom.unassociatedPartName: Edit the name of your unassociated <1 /> part
bom.quantityAvailable: Edit the quantity available in your <1 />inventory
bom.editReferenceId: Edit your custom <1 />reference Id(s) you can use for identifying this part.
bom.editSchematicReferenceId: Edit your custom <1 />schematic reference Id(s) that identify the part on the PCB silkscreen. <3 />Examples: <5>D1</5>, <7>C2</7>, <9>Q1</9>
bom.movePart: Move selected parts to another tab

popup.makerSubscriptionRequired: Requires a Maker level subscription. <1>Click here</1> for details.
popup.proSubscriptionRequired: Requires a Professional level subscription. <1>Click here</1> for details.

versionBanner.newVersion: A new version of Binner <1>{{version}}</1> is available!
